Method.desc: Record all windows' information to cache file
Method.doc:
Record all windows' information to cache file

Parameters:
 * scene - The name of the scene to be recorded. Alternatively, set it to nil to prompt the user to input the scene name or choose an existing scene name. (optional)

Returns:
 * None
Method.name: record_all_windows
parameters: * scene - The name of the scene to be recorded. Alternatively, set it to nil to prompt the user to input the scene name or choose an existing scene name. (optional)

Method.desc: Restore all windows' information from cache file
Method.doc:
Restore all windows' information from cache file

Parameters:
 * scene - The name of the scene to be restore. Alternatively, set it to nil to prompt the user to input the scene name or choose an existing scene name. (optional)

Returns:
 * None
Method.name: restore_all_windows
parameters: * scene - The name of the scene to be restore. Alternatively, set it to nil to prompt the user to input the scene name or choose an existing scene name. (optional)

Method.desc: Set the root path of the cache file
Method.doc:
Set the root path of the cache file

Parameters:
 * path - The root path of the cache file
  (e.g., '/Users/yourname/.cache/hammerspoon/') (optional)
  If not set, the default path is '/Users/yourname/.cache/hammerspoon/'
  You can get the current user's home directory by os.getenv('HOME')

Returns:
 * None
Method.name: set_cache_root
parameters: * path - The root path of the cache file (e.g., '/Users/yourname/.cache/hammerspoon/') (optional) If not set, the default path is '/Users/yourname/.cache/hammerspoon/' You can get the current user's home directory by os.getenv('HOME')

desc: It can record all windows' information to a cache file and
doc:
It can record all windows' information to a cache file and
restore all windows' information from the cache file, including restoring windows to their original positions ... etc.

name: Snapshot
stripped_doc: restore all windows' information from the cache file, including restoring windows to their original positions ... etc.
